WorkItem.Description:
The 2 piece bonus for Koltira's Plate or Thassarian's Plate does not seem to be properly implemented: It shows up in the tooltip as "0.05 Bonus Blood Strike Damage / 0.05 Bonus Heart Strike Damage" and is ranked as adding near-zero value as a buff under Buffs > Set Bonuses. This should be a 5% increase in Blood/Heart Strike damage, but it seems to be implemented as a microscopic amount of bonus damage.
Â 
Of course, without the ability to poke around in set bonuses like we can items, it's difficult for me as an end user to identify exactly how this set bonus is calculated. I may be completely wrong in how this is intended to work.

Comments.Message: I'll check on that.  I think the number is correct, but the display may be wrong, and yeah, the 2pc T9 bonus is a bit lack-luster for tanking.

Thanks! And yeah a lot of tanking bonuses I've seen are pretty lackluster, like the 2T10 bonus for druids. Sure, Swipe doing 20% extra damage is good for AoE threat... but that's generally on trash and I haven't needed a lot of help on AoE threat on my bear anyway--and just exactly how much of Lacerate's threat is the actual damage? Not a lot, I heard... though honestly the 4T10 bonuses are insanely good for both cat and bear. An extra mitigation cooldown? Rake critting?! Yes please. >:3

Welll, all 4 tanking specs, the 4-piece is similart to one another. but yea, the 2 piece is mostly a threat increase (marginal but an increase) and the 4-piece is an extra cd we can work with. Especially useful on LK.
ok... yeah, it was totally mis-using the stats related to this set bonus.  So I'm fixing this.
